title: 8 Tips For Dry Climate Gardening Without Irrigation (Dust Mulch Wide Spacing Hugelpaths Etc.)

tasks.task: Planting corn and beans without irrigation
subtasks: Place wood chips around corn plants
Plant beans near corn in loosened soil
Dig out paths between garden rows
Fill dug-out paths with rotted wood
Cover wood-filled paths with soil to form slight depressions
Apply straw mulch to cabbage plants
Use weeds as mulch when available
Hoe weeds after heavy rain to create a dust mulch
Plant seeds in mounded "hills" without rows
Create mounds with 18-inch spacing in between
Cover filled paths with soil and wood chips
